text: Hello! This is driving me crazy but, HubSpot suddenly refused to reflect changes I made to a file I'm editing (module.css). It was working fine a few minutes ago, but suddenly, when I publish changes, I'm no longer seeing them on the live page. >_< Can someone shed light on this?..
Oh wow, so NOW it's working after I complain about it here.. haha :smile: oh well

Hargh, I'm trying to embed another meeting calendar on a page using <https://static.hsappstatic.net/MeetingsEmbed/ex/MeetingsEmbedCode.js> that renders things with `.meetings-iframe-container` and a `data-src` into calendar, but I'm having the first iframe render a bit taller than the other one.

Is this a known issue? I'm contemplating either forcing the iframes with some `!important` css brutality or attaching a MutationObserver to the things and then forcing the height attributes all over again after HubSpot is done with them :zany_face:

E. OK so I did some testing and it appears the meeting calendars before the last one are rendered a bit taller, maybe to separate them from each other, which is handy I guess, except when it isn't
It's probably the CDN cache, best to view the page in preview mode for instant changes
Use the HubSpot dev tool chrome extension. It has a cache buster on it that will force hs to render a non cached version of the page.
is "marketing events with Zoom" still in Beta? Any additional info about?
is there a way to prevent dates from changing regardless of timezone?
have you tried setting the timezone with datetime format? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#datetimeformat>
